sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; In (Indium powder) - Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal suppliers or chemical supply stores; Ti (Titanium powder) - Metal suppliers or specialized online stores.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; In (Indium powder) - Metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal suppliers or chemical supply stores; Ti (Titanium powder) - Metal suppliers or specialized online stores.

1. Measure the ingredients using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured B, In, Ni, and Ti powders. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous blend is obtained. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 1 hour to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure the ingredients using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured B, In, Ni, and Ti powders. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous blend is obtained. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 1 hour to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1000 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1000 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.

steps: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
